intro: Haplolobus, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly in countries like South Africa and Namibia. Haplolobus species are typically found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. These plants are often used in traditional medicine and are valued for their ornamental appeal.
